abiotics_diseases_d.cause: Caused by environmental stress such as drought, nutrient deficiencies, or temperature extremes.

treatment.organic: Improve soil health with compost and mulch, ensure proper irrigation and crop rotation.
treatment.chemical: Foliar application of micronutrients if deficiency is diagnosed.

aphids_p.cause: Infestation by aphids that feed on sap and transmit plant viruses.

treatment.organic: Spray neem oil or use lady beetles as biological control.
treatment.chemical: Apply insecticides such as imidacloprid or thiamethoxam.

curvulariosis_d.cause: Fungal disease caused by Curvularia spp.

treatment.organic: Improve air circulation and apply compost teas or Trichoderma.
treatment.chemical: Use fungicides like mancozeb or azoxystrobin.

treatment.organic: Maintain good agricultural practices.
treatment.chemical: Not applicable.

helminthosporiosis_d.cause: Fungal infection caused by Helminthosporium species.

treatment.organic: Crop rotation and sanitation, use of resistant varieties.
treatment.chemical: Apply fungicides such as propiconazole or carbendazim.

rust_d.cause: Fungal disease caused by Puccinia sorghi.

treatment.organic: Plant resistant varieties and use crop rotation.
treatment.chemical: Spray fungicides like tebuconazole or mancozeb.

spodoptera_frugiperda_d.cause: Leaf damage caused by Spodoptera frugiperda (fall armyworm) larvae.

treatment.organic: Use pheromone traps and biological agents like Bacillus thuringiensis.
treatment.chemical: Apply insecticides such as lambda-cyhalothrin or chlorpyrifos.

treatment.organic: Intercropping and natural enemies like Trichogramma.
treatment.chemical: Use systemic insecticides like emamectin benzoate.

stripe_d.cause: Symptoms may be due to maize stripe virus or nutrient imbalance.

treatment.organic: Remove infected plants and improve soil fertility.
treatment.chemical: Control insect vectors with insecticides; apply micronutrients if needed.

alternaria_d.cause: Fungal disease caused by Alternaria solani (early blight).

treatment.organic: Apply compost tea and rotate crops.
treatment.chemical: Use fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb.

alternaria_mite_d.cause: Combination of Alternaria fungal infection and mite infestation.

treatment.organic: Neem oil and predatory mites.
treatment.chemical: Apply miticides and broad-spectrum fungicides.

bacterial_floundering_d.cause: Caused by bacterial pathogens like Pseudomonas or Xanthomonas.

treatment.organic: Remove infected plants and apply copper-based sprays.
treatment.chemical: Use bactericides like copper hydroxide.

blossom_end_rot_d.cause: Calcium deficiency often due to irregular watering.

treatment.organic: Mulch and apply calcium-rich compost.
treatment.chemical: Foliar sprays of calcium chloride or calcium nitrate.

fusarium_d.cause: Fungal infection by Fusarium oxysporum causing wilt.

treatment.organic: Use resistant varieties and improve soil health.
treatment.chemical: Apply systemic fungicides like benomyl.

healthy_fruit.cause: No visible disease or pest damage.

treatment.organic: Continue good horticultural practices.
treatment.chemical: Not applicable.

healthy_leaf.cause: No visible disease or pest damage.

treatment.organic: Continue good horticultural practices.
treatment.chemical: Not applicable.

treatment.organic: Use pheromone traps and neem oil.
treatment.chemical: Apply insecticides like spinosad or indoxacarb.

mite_d.cause: Damage caused by spider mites sucking sap from leaves.

treatment.organic: Spray neem oil or use predatory mites.
treatment.chemical: Use acaricides like abamectin.

treatment.organic: Balance soil nutrients using compost.
treatment.chemical: Adjust fertilizer applications based on soil tests.

sunburn_d.cause: Overexposure to sunlight and heat on fruit surfaces.

treatment.organic: Improve canopy cover and use shade nets.
treatment.chemical: Not applicable.

tomato_late_blight_d.cause: Caused by Phytophthora infestans, a water mold.

treatment.organic: Use resistant varieties and avoid overhead irrigation.
treatment.chemical: Apply fungicides like metalaxyl or copper oxychloride.

tuta_absoluta_p.cause: Infestation by tomato leaf miner (Tuta absoluta).

treatment.organic: Pheromone traps and neem extracts.
treatment.chemical: Use insecticides like spinosad or emamectin benzoate.

virosis_d.cause: Viral infection (e.g., tomato yellow leaf curl virus) transmitted by insects.

treatment.organic: Control insect vectors and remove infected plants.
treatment.chemical: Apply insecticides to control whiteflies and aphids.

alternaria_d.cause: Fungal infection caused by Alternaria porri (purple blotch).

treatment.organic: Use crop rotation, improve air circulation, and apply compost tea.
treatment.chemical: Apply fungicides like mancozeb or chlorothalonil.

bulb_blight_d.cause: Fungal or bacterial infection affecting onion bulbs.

treatment.organic: Use well-drained soil and avoid waterlogging.
treatment.chemical: Apply appropriate fungicides like carbendazim.

caterpillars_p.cause: Infestation by caterpillars feeding on onion foliage.

treatment.organic: Use neem oil or introduce natural predators like birds.
treatment.chemical: Apply insecticides such as spinosad or lambda-cyhalothrin.

fusarium_d.cause: Basal rot caused by Fusarium oxysporum.

treatment.organic: Rotate crops and use compost with Trichoderma.
treatment.chemical: Apply fungicides like thiophanate-methyl.

treatment.organic: Continue with good cultivation practices.
treatment.chemical: Not applicable.

virosis_d.cause: Viral infection causing distorted growth and chlorosis.

treatment.organic: Control insect vectors and remove infected plants.
treatment.chemical: Apply insecticides to control vectors; no direct treatment for virus.
